fields.description:
After [installing the Eucalyptus user console, I attempt to start the service (which reports OK)|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/console-guide/console_config_locating_config_file.html#console_config_locating_config_file] in order to [start the configuration section of the Eucalyptus User Console documentation|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/console-guide/console_configure_intro.html#console_configure_intro]:

{code}
[hspencer@odc-c-06 ~]$ sudo /sbin/service eucalyptus-console start
[sudo] password for hspencer:
Starting eucalyptus-console:                               [  OK  ]
[hspencer@odc-c-06 ~]$ sudo /sbin/service eucalyptus-console status
euca-console-server is stopped
{code}

I check /var/log/messages and see the following error:
{code}
Jun 28 08:03:00 odc-c-06 abrt: detected unhandled Python exception in '/usr/bin/euca-console-server'
Jun 28 08:03:00 odc-c-06 abrtd: New client connected
Jun 28 08:03:00 odc-c-06 abrt-server[4534]: Saved Python crash dump of pid 4533 to /var/spool/abrt/pyhook-2013-06-28-08:03:00-4533
Jun 28 08:03:00 odc-c-06 abrtd: Directory 'pyhook-2013-06-28-08:03:00-4533' creation detected
Jun 28 08:03:00 odc-c-06 abrtd: Package 'eucalyptus-console' isn't signed with proper key
Jun 28 08:03:00 odc-c-06 abrtd: 'post-create' on '/var/spool/abrt/pyhook-2013-06-28-08:03:00-4533' exited with 1
Jun 28 08:03:00 odc-c-06 abrtd: Corrupted or bad directory '/var/spool/abrt/pyhook-2013-06-28-08:03:00-4533', deleting
{code}

There are no iptables rules in place:

{code}
[hspencer@odc-c-06 ~]$ iptables-save
[hspencer@odc-c-06 ~]$
{code}

Permissions for /etc/eucalyptus-console look correct:

{code}
[hspencer@odc-c-06 ~]$ ls -ail /etc/eucalyptus-console/
total 20
1049774 drwxr-xr-x   2 eucaconsole eucaconsole 4096 Jun 28 08:00 .
1048577 drwxr-xr-x. 76 root        root        4096 Jun 28 08:32 ..
1049959 -rw-------   1 eucaconsole eucaconsole 1517 Jun 28 07:50 console.crt
1049960 -rw-r--r--   1 eucaconsole eucaconsole 2890 Jun 28 07:59 console.ini
1049958 -rw-------   1 eucaconsole eucaconsole 1704 Jun 28 07:50 console.key
{code}

console service doesn't start based upon console.ini configuration (uiport=80):

{code}
$ sudo netstat -pln
Active Internet connections (only servers)
Proto Recv-Q Send-Q Local Address               Foreign Address             State       PID/Program name
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:22                  0.0.0.0:*                   LISTEN      4015/sshd
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:25                0.0.0.0:*                   LISTEN      4093/master
tcp        0      0 :::22                       :::*                        LISTEN      4015/sshd
tcp        0      0 ::1:25                      :::*                        LISTEN      4093/master
udp        0      0 0.0.0.0:68                  0.0.0.0:*                               1173/dhclient
Active UNIX domain sockets (only servers)
Proto RefCnt Flags       Type       State         I-Node PID/Program name    Path
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12071  3982/sssd_nss       /var/lib/sss/pipes/nss
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12078  3983/sssd_pam       /var/lib/sss/pipes/pam
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12080  3983/sssd_pam       /var/lib/sss/pipes/private/pam
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     11519  3886/dbus-daemon    /var/run/dbus/system_bus_socket
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     11600  3915/acpid          /var/run/acpid.socket
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12043  3980/sssd           /var/lib/sss/pipes/private/sbus-monitor
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12052  3981/sssd_be        /var/lib/sss/pipes/private/sbus-dp_default.3981
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12429  4115/abrtd          /var/run/abrt/abrt.socket
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12459  4093/master         public/cleanup
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12466  4093/master         private/tlsmgr
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12470  4093/master         private/rewrite
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12474  4093/master         private/bounce
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12478  4093/master         private/defer
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12482  4093/master         private/trace
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12486  4093/master         private/verify
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12490  4093/master         public/flush
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12494  4093/master         private/proxymap
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12498  4093/master         private/proxywrite
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12502  4093/master         private/smtp
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12506  4093/master         private/relay
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12510  4093/master         public/showq
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12514  4093/master         private/error
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12518  4093/master         private/retry
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     7331   1/init              @/com/ubuntu/upstart
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     12522  4093/master         private/discard

unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     11630  3924/hald           @/var/run/hald/dbus-jt2LqhSbuQ
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     11635  3924/hald           @/var/run/hald/dbus-vgFKdk43F5
{code}
fields.summary: Error when starting User Console; keeps eucalyptus-console-server from starting
fields.environment: User console is on a separate machine from the CLC

comments.body:
Added sosreport from User Console.

Options enabled in the console.ini file:

{code}
args=(sys.stdout,)
class=StreamHandler
clchost=10.104.1.216
clcwebport=8443
datefmt=%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S
format=%(asctime)-15s %(levelname)s %(message)s
[formatter_eucaformat]
formatter=eucaformat
[formatters]
[handler_eucahandler]
[handlers]
handlers=eucahandler
help.url=https://engage.eucalyptus.com?r=euca-
keys=eucaformat
keys=eucahandler
keys=root
language=en_US
level=INFO
level=NOTSET
[locale]
[logger_root]
[loggers]
[paths]
pollfreq=20
pollfreq.images=60
[server]
session.abs.timeout=43200
session.idle.timeout=1800
sslcert=/etc/eucalyptus-console/console.crt
sslkey=/etc/eucalyptus-console/console.key
staticpath: /usr/share/eucalyptus-console/static
support.url=http://your-cloud-admin-portal/
support.url=mailto: harold.spencer.jr@eucalyptus.com
[test]
threads.max=50
uiport=80
url.rewrite=False
usemock=False
{code}

After looking at the error logs even more, looks like the eucalyptus-console package is not signed with the right key:

{code}
Jun 28 09:11:13 odc-c-06 abrt-server[25350]: Saved Python crash dump of pid 25349 to /var/spool/abrt/pyhook-2013-06-28-09:11:13-25349
Jun 28 09:11:13 odc-c-06 abrtd: Directory 'pyhook-2013-06-28-09:11:13-25349' creation detected
Jun 28 09:11:13 odc-c-06 abrtd: Package 'eucalyptus-console' isn't signed with proper key
Jun 28 09:11:13 odc-c-06 abrtd: 'post-create' on '/var/spool/abrt/pyhook-2013-06-28-09:11:13-25349' exited with 1
Jun 28 09:11:13 odc-c-06 abrtd: Corrupted or bad directory '/var/spool/abrt/pyhook-2013-06-28-09:11:13-25349', deleting
{code}

Here are some additional system information:

_Package info for eucalyptus-console_

{code}
# yum info eucalyptus-console
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror, security
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus-console
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.3.0.1
Release     : 0.0.1093.el6
Size        : 5.1 M
Repo        : installed
From repo   : eucalyptus-release
Summary     : Client user interface for Eucalyptus
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
License     : GPLv3 and BSD
Description : Client user interface for Eucalyptus.
{code}

_Listed Repos_

{code}
# yum repolist
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror, security
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
repo id                                                           repo name                                                                                             status
base                                                              CentOS-6 - Base                                                                                       6,381
elrepo                                                            ELRepo.org Community Enterprise Linux Repository - el6                                                  269
epel                                                              Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux 6 - x86_64                                                        8,954
euca2ools-release                                                 euca2ools-release                                                                                         6
eucalyptus-release                                                eucalyptus-release                                                                                       35
extras                                                            CentOS-6 - Extras                                                                                        12
updates                                                           CentOS-6 - Updates                                                                                      766
repolist: 16,423
{code}

_Repo keys_

{code}
# ls -l /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/
total 32
-rw-r--r--  1 root root 1695 Jun  9 14:30 euca2ools-release.pub
-rw-r--r--  1 root root 1695 Jun 15 08:11 eucalyptus-release.pub
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 1706 Feb 25 00:57 RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-6
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 1730 Feb 25 00:57 RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-Debug-6
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 1730 Feb 25 00:57 RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-Security-6
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 1734 Feb 25 00:57 RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-Testing-6
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 1722 Jan  8 06:08 RPM-GPG-KEY-elrepo.org
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 1649 Nov  4  2012 RPM-GPG-KEY-EPEL-6
{code}


[~mspaulding], is there a way to confirm if the package has been signed by the proper repo key?

Using 'rpm' shows the signature information for you:

{code}
~% rpm -qpi eucalyptus-console-3.3.0.1-0.0.1093.el6.noarch.rpm        
warning: eucalyptus-console-3.3.0.1-0.0.1093.el6.noarch.rpm: Header V3 RSA/SHA1 Signature, key ID c1240596: NOKEY
Name        : eucalyptus-console
Version     : 3.3.0.1
Release     : 0.0.1093.el6
Architecture: noarch
Install Date: (not installed)
Group       : Applications/System
Size        : 5309866
License     : GPLv3 and BSD
Signature   : RSA/SHA1, Thu 20 Jun 2013 02:27:56 PM PDT, Key ID be264d09c1240596
Source RPM  : eucalyptus-3.3.0.1-0.0.1093.el6.src.rpm
Build Date  : Thu 20 Jun 2013 01:51:49 PM PDT
Build Host  : ip-172-17-41-168
Relocations : (not relocatable)
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
Summary     : Client user interface for Eucalyptus
Description :
Client user interface for Eucalyptus.
{code}

It appears, based on the above information, that the 3.3.0.1 version of eucalyptus-console is signed with the release key.

Thanks for the response [~mspaulding].  As we discussed in IRC and the euca-users mailing list, looks like if the uiport is set to 80, this causes issues due to permissions issues.  

{code}
[hspencer@odc-c-06 ~]$ sudo runuser eucaconsole -c "euca-console-server"
[sudo] password for hspencer:
2013-06-28 15:41:09 INFO Starting Eucalyptus Console
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/euca-console-server", line 195, in <module>
    start_console()
  File "/usr/bin/euca-console-server", line 135, in start_console
    httpserver.listen(server_port)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/netutil.py", line 99, in listen
    sockets = bind_sockets(port, address=address)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/tornado/netutil.py", line 264, in bind_sockets
    sock.bind(sockaddr)
  File "<string>", line 1, in bind
socket.error: [Errno 13] Permission denied
{code}

After setting the uiport to 8888, the User Console started without any issues.
Attached DOC-917, since this will document this behavior and the proper steps on how to change uiports for the Eucalyptus User Console.
Confirmed issue.  In order to resolve it, had to move uiport back to 8888.  Doc ticket has been raised and attached.

Hey [~tjcramer],

I attached a DOC ticket that Scot created.  I think once we get this documented, and (possible) create the abrt issue as an improvement, I think we can mark this as resolved. 

That sound good?
[~tjcramer], the package is signed properly, but there is an error message emitted by the abrtd service. The message can be safely ignored. I've explained the situation in my above comments.
After reading through this, it's not apparent what the required steps are to change the default port. Please clarify.
[~dkavanagh], can you help shed some light here as to any documentation regarding changing the default port for the Eucalyptus Console?
This should be addressed by better error handling when starting the console server via the init scripts.  If the bind to address:port fails, it should error as such.

I believe changing the port is done via the console.ini file. 

Talking with [~eucacolby], he would like to be able to run the ECC console on the default https port 443 so that users don't have to enter a port at all when they type in the address. This would be a usability plus for the ECC.

Just synced with [~jloza] and [~eucacolby].  The issue here is that we're running it on the CLC, so eucalyptus-cloud is bound to this port already.  The underlying problem is the fact that we don't error out nicely to the administrator/user.  First the admin has to configure abrt keys or run euca-console-server with:

{code}sudo runuser eucaconsole -c "euca-console-server"{code}

Is the task here really to have better output when we fail to bind to the port? It sounds like attempting to use an already used port is a problem the administrator would need to solve.
I know when I run the console as a developer with a script, it reports;
"
...
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tornado-2.4-py2.7.egg/tornado/netutil.py", line 286, in bind_sockets
    sock.bind(sockaddr)
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 224, in meth
    return getattr(self._sock,name)(*args)
socket.error: [Errno 48] Address already in use
"
That's fine when starting it from a script as a dev but when you run via the init script, you get absolutely nothing other than an attempted crash dump via abrt.

I'm going to ask that [~gholms] take a look since he was working on the packaging most recently. The init script falls under the packaging bailiwick.

I wonder if you see any error in /var/log/messages? I think the logging system is connected to syslog prior to starting Tornado, which is where the port bind error comes up.
Nope, the only error in /var/log/messages is abrt being triggered.
I'm up for re-thinking the user of syslog vs a file logger like our other services.
dup of EUCA-7950
Closing Resolved issues for released versions of the software.
